items.title: Enterprise Account Executive (Sales)- Spanish speaking
items.content:
InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 4 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com andInVisionApp.com/blog.

We're looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to accelerate the already rapid growth of our Enterprise sales efforts. As an Enterprise Account Executive at InVision, you should be a sales hunter experienced in selling SAAS to c-level buyers within Design and other lines of business. You should be passionate about design and your customers , with a high level of sales acumen and an ability to drives sales cycles to a close and compress decision making timelines. Ideally you’re someone who can do this with a high level of energy and a sense of humor, and are excited to be a part of our unique team and culture.

Responsibilities:

Passionately evangelize InVision and Design thinking to VP-Level+ product teams at Fortune 5000 companies
Manage full sales cycle in a consultative manner, from initial qualification through product demo through follow up calls to closing
Develop new business opportunities through proactive efforts, in addition to handling incoming leads
Exceed activity, pipeline, and revenue targets
Coach team members and accept coaching whenever it is given

*Requirements*

*5 years or more of account based sales experience in a B2B SaaS vertical
*Proven track record demonstrating ability to engage, and consultatively sell to, c-level product executives
*Experience working with Customer Success and Sales Development in a pod based structure
*Proven track record exceeding quota
*Referenceable executive-level customers at Fortune 2000 companies, major digital agencies and prominent tech firms
*Passion, enthusiasm, energy, humor, and the ability to convey this through phone and email communications
*Passion for design


*Internal Support Structure*

*Business Development Representative to help you grow opportunities through outbound prospecting & *Inbound Qualifying who will pass you leads
*Sales Operations team to process orders and tackle contract challenges
*Sales Enablement team to help ensure you receive ongoing training and development
*In-house counsel to assist on legal matters
*Visionary leadership with years of tactical expertise to mentor and guide you through the big wins
*Post-sales Customer Success teams designed to ensure customer delight once the deal is won

items.title: Engagement Manager at Citrusbyte (Los Angeles, CA)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Technologies

productleader

Job description

Company Overview

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating the qualities of leadership, autonomy, and excellence in all of our people. We build medium and large scale systems, platforms, applications, and services, that solve our customers' business-critical problems.

  • We really care about Culture
    • Extreme ownership; no micromanaging; flat organizational hierarchy
    • Radical candor; real-time feedback
    • Organizational transparency
    • Annual team retreat with full services team (recent highlights: Costa Rica, Belize, Tuscany)
  • We believe that Accountability, Autonomy and Authority interdependent
  • We care about Happiness, and we measure it transparently

Job Summary

You are the directly responsible for client satisfaction - you ensure that we're solving the right problems with the right solutions, that our teams are staffed appropriately, that our project plans have the right strategy, and that the work we're doing delivers the greatest value possible to our customers.

You are entrepreneurially minded and there are no barriers to how you approach helping our customers solve their problems. You are a mentor and coach, and you grow those around you. You are the most senior consultant on an account.

Helping our customers is personal to you - this is something you do backed by your personal standards for expertise, quality & service. You become a trusted advisor to our customers and help them in unexpected and delightful ways.

You were probably a senior product manager or program manager in the past and you understand exactly what goes into being a successful product team in a consultative relationship. You demonstrate the ability to plan, organize and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery.

Mission

  1. Ensure client stakeholders & teams love working with us.
  2. Ensure we deliver on our promises
  3. Ensure our plan results in building the most valuable things

Responsibilities and Duties

You're ultimately the person responsible for making sure the project succeeds:

  • You are measured on client happiness, team happiness, quality results.
  • Demonstrates ability to plan, organize and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery.
  • You empower our teams to come up with the plan and do their best work, and provide coaching to them as necessary.
  • You review what the team does and provide coaching where necessary.
  • You ensure our teams are planning, consulting and doing work that meets our standards and your personal standards to ensure client happiness.
  • You make all final calls about team staffing.
  • You make all final calls about services team mission and the strategy for us to build the most valuable thing possible.
  • You are a partner to the sales team in each account.

Starting new projects:

  • You own responsibility for kicking off new projects, so you consult directly with clients, our internal resourcing teams and sales to create and execute on a plan.
  • You support our sales team in qualifying new opportunities.

You are an expert, a trusted advisor and a consultant:

  • You make solving hard challenges look effortless, you exude mastery
  • You make it personal; you invest in relationships with our customers and help them grow to be better
  • Clients know that with you on their project, they can rest easy at night. You'll never let them down.

You increase ways we're helping our customers.

  • You ask yourself "what else can we do to help our customers?", "What is our customers biggest problem they haven't told us about yet?"
  • You can expand our areas of influence to help process, culture, systems, tools, training for their people, etc.

Benefits and Perks

100% REMOTE

TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.

HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.

HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.

Apply now

About Citrusbyte

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating the qualities of leadership, autonomy, and excellence in all of our people.

items.title: Paved: Campaign Manager
items.content:
Campaign Manager

Posted Jun 8

Paved
Headquarters: New York, NY
Paved.com
View all Paved jobs →

Looking to make an impact? Ready to hustle? Join a team of energetic self starters who are carving out an exciting product category for online advertising and marketing.

This role requires someone who has a passion for media and advertising, is eager to grow and learn, and has an unparalleled attention to detail. You will be responsible for managing our clients’ marketing and advertising campaigns through the post-sales cycle, and will be our liaison between publishers and our sales team.

We’re looking for the perfect person who can define—and refine—the practices and processes around our clients’ marketing campaigns. Clever thinking, an ability to learn and take direction, and a persistent positive attitude are more important than experience.

The position is FULLY remote, and offers flexibility and independence in exchange for hard work and positive outcomes. We’re an upbeat, motivated team who enjoy a goal oriented culture and fun work environment.

We are looking for someone who matches our level of joy for the work we do, fits in well with the team, and elevates our game. A sense of humor, a lack of ego, and a desire to do great work is essential.

About the role:

  • Assist the sales team in executing and managing publisher campaigns.
  • Oversee the entire ad execution process and respond to any questions or issues from our clients.
  • Keep tabs on all campaigns and engage with clients that become unresponsive or delayed. It’s imperative that our campaigns are executed expediently.
  • Obtain and approve campaign collateral from our clients. Resolve errors.
  • Verify all ads to ensure proper tracking is implemented.
  • Manage, track and report all campaign activity. Iterate and improve accordingly.
  • Identify new feature requests and opportunities. You will be responsible for relaying these to the internal team, as communicating platform updates to our clients.

The ideal candidate:

  • is a clever thinker and has an insatiable curiosity.
  • brainstorms well with others and is generally open minded.
  • has a good old fashioned work ethic, day in and day out. He/she has grit and takes initiative and ownership to see things through to completion. If it needs doing, it gets done.
  • has some experience in B2B sales, sales development, or business development.
  • is a great communicator, writer, and problem solver. Has passion, enthusiasm, energy, humor, and the ability to convey this through phone and email communications.
  • has a bias towards immediate action and results.
  • enjoys working independently with minimal supervision.
  • at minimum, has a basic knowledge of web technologies and marketing software.
  • is excited by working on a small, collaborative, innovative team and recognizes that success for any product is ultimately measured by the success of its customers.
  • is well organized, detail-oriented, and self-driven.
  • has the ability to work well under pressure and deadlines, all while exuding positive vibes.

Apply for this position

You can apply here: https://paved.workable.com/jobs/744438

Job Description

How you’ll make a difference

As an Account Executive, you will play an essential role in Aproplan as you will have a massive impact on its growth. Our sales team shares the Aproplan success story with construction companies in Netherlands and helps them understand the value Aproplan offers to align improve their construction project. With an extra Account Executive, Aproplan can grow even faster and stronger!

Apply here: https://jobs.lever.co/aproplan/cf12eb2d-aff5-46f2-9f0d-b6714271fbea

The life of an Enterprise Account Executive at Aproplan

- Ask questions and uncover our prospects' pains
- Challenge them and evangelise
- Show them the value of our Aproplan solution and question their status quo
- Involve our Customer Success team and help our prospects preparing a business case
- Build a network of C-level executives and discover how businesses work in no time
- Watch your prospects become real Aproplan fans rather than just customers
- Learn every single day amazing things from extremely talented sales professionals, your colleagues!

To be successful you need

- Experience with selling solutions or services (experience with enterprise software/SaaS is a plus)
- A proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets consistently
- Experience with calling on decision makers and executives
- Start up DNA
- Outstanding communication skills. Sales training is a plus, native Dutch and fluency in English is a must
- Experience with CRM (Salesforce would be great!)
- Passion for life and the Aproplan product
- The desire to grow yourself, your team and the company
- The will to have a maximum impact on Aproplan
- The desire to work in an amazing team
- To have downloaded a Free Trial of Aproplan and browsed our website before applying, so you know what kind of company we are and what we do.

What you'll get in return

- The opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing SaaS companies in the construction sector
- The chance to make a real, impactful difference
- To work with the latest technologies (Mac, Android and Windows)
-Great working atmosphere with a young, dynamic team in the coolest offices out there
- Huge growth and learning potential

This is us

Aproplan is a young fast growing B2B SAAS scale-up from Belgium, which has the ambition to completely disturb the construction sector starting from the construction site. An easy-to-use, straightforward interface combined with plenty of integration and reasonable pricing makes Aproplan an excellent solution.

What do we do for whom?

For construction managers, architect and engineers who are looking to replace pen and paper in the construction process by digitilazing their plans, punchlists, fieldnotes, inspection reports, AproPLAN’s simple to use collaborative software centralize everything in the cloud and saving them hours of admin work each day.

Apply here: https://jobs.lever.co/aproplan/cf12eb2d-aff5-46f2-9f0d-b6714271fbea

items.title: Paperless Pipeline: Join Paperless Pipeline’s Sales Team
items.content:
Join Paperless Pipeline’s Sales Team

Posted Jun 6

Paperless Pipeline
Headquarters: Remote

View all Paperless Pipeline jobs →

Hi there.  We’re Paperless Pipeline, and we’re looking for a sales assistant to join our small but highly impactful team of 12 fun-loving, go-getters spread across the U.S.   

Here’s what our next dream teammate looks like:

About You

  • You are legally permitted to work in the United States.

  • You are comfortable working without constant supervision. You channel self-motivation and discipline to get things done. On time.

  • You love listening to people. You ask great questions because you know sales success is all about asking meaningful questions, listening, and grasping what prospective customers want to accomplish.

  • You communicate clearly and explain things in a simple way.

  • You take pride in your work. But you thrive on critical feedback.

  • You have hands-on experience with B2B SaaS.

  • You pay attention to detail.

  • You are obsessed with and have a proven track record of continuous improvement.

Your Responsibilities


  • Collaborate with Paperless Pipeline’s sales and customer care teams to delight new and prospective customers.

  • Become an expert on Paperless Pipeline’s strengths and capabilities.  Provide purposeful consultation to prospects who have created a free trial account.

  • Pre-qualify prospects by inbound and outbound phone calls and emails.

  • Proactively follow up with prospects by phone, email, and live chat to help them customize and effectively use their trial account.

More About Paperless Pipeline


Paperless Pipeline (aka Pipeline) is the simple yet powerful real estate transaction management software loved by nearly 70,000 real estate agents and brokers across the U.S. and Canada.

Pipeline is a bootstrapped, profitable, and self-sustaining business that has steadily grown since its inception in 2009.

Our team is small by design because that enables us to be impactful, effective, and responsive to customers’ needs.

Learn more at paperlesspipeline.com.

How to Apply

Send an email to jobs@paperlesspipeline.com and include the subject line: Sales Assistant

We ignore run­-of-­the-­mill résumés and LinkedIn profiles. So tell us your story with a thoughtfully written email instead. 

Apply for this position

See how to apply section above.

items.title: Skillcrush: Director of Sales & Revenue
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Director of Sales & Revenue

Posted Jun 4

Skillcrush
Headquarters: Worldwide
https://skillcrush.breezy.hr/p/58b33c363426-director-of-sales-revenue?source=weworkremotely
View all Skillcrush jobs →

Skillcrush is on the hunt for a Director of Sales & Revenue to join our team! This is a full-time, senior-level role.

The Sales team at Skillcrush is made up of marketing automation experts, copywriters, and inside sales counselors who help our potential students understand how learning digital skills with Skillcrush can transform their careers.

As Director of Sales & Revenue, you’ll lead the Sales team by driving the strategy, execution, and measurement of all middle and bottom-of-the-funnel sales and conversion activities. You’ll also work closely with the Leads team, the marketing team responsible for top-of-the-funnel lead generation. And you’ll be a part of the Management team and work closely with our CEO and other Directors to inform the strategic direction of the company.

You’re a good fit for this role if you have a deep understanding of consumer conversion marketing and extensive experience in consumer, direct response sales strategy development, planning, and execution as these will be the main focus of your work. You should have a proven track record in setting KPIs and reaching revenue goals, be highly data-driven, and believe strongly in the value of testing, measurements, and analysis since you will be both establishing the direction of the Sales team and answering for its results.

This position will require you to be familiar with (and sometimes take part in) the work of each member of the Sales team and to effectively lead, manage, and develop them in creating the right messages and using the right methods to reach our ideal audience. You’ll need to have a practical understanding of each team member’s day-to-day tasks and the ability to make sure they contribute to overall goals and results.

You should be able to easily move from the strategic to the tactical and back again while being proactive but not reactive and to build a consumer-focused, direct response sales organization and processes that scale. In addition, you’ll be expected to have a deep understanding of and passion for the Skillcrush mission and our products so you can promote them via sales and conversion activities and as a member of the executive group guiding the company as a whole.

Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment, while contributing to our positive and supportive culture. Additional experience – such as a background in creating online consumer brands, female-focused marketing, online education marketing and sales and/or remote working across different time zones (as we’re a fully remote team) – is strongly preferred but not required.

Reports to:

Adda Birnir (CEO)

Responsibilities

  • Works with the CEO to set sales and revenue goals and serves as the principal person in charge of and responsible for meeting these goals.
  • Directs high-level sales strategy across all customer segments and translates strategy into yearly, quarterly, and monthly sales planning to achieve sales and revenue goals.
  • Researches and identifies new sales opportunities from sales conversion and content optimization and works with the Product Development team to determine new product and product marketing opportunities based on sales activities and experiments.
  • Coordinates with the Director of Marketing to ensure that the cumulative sales and marketing budget is used to maximize ROI and that new partnership opportunities are considered.
  • Serves as Product Owner of the Sales team managing the team backlog, setting weekly sprint priorities, monitoring the amount of and completion of work, and keeping all teams aware of sales initiatives and the Sales team aware of product changes.
  • Develops members of the Sales team through coaching related to their day-to-day duties, conducting performance reviews, coordinating training and development needed for new sales directions and optimizations, and creating and modelling a culture of continuous feedback, learning, and iteration.
Requirements

  • Experience in a senior marketing and/or sales role where you were responsible for setting sales and revenue goals, ideally at a digital product-driven consumer company.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop strategy for middle and bottom-of-the-funnel sales and conversion activities.
  • Demonstrated ability to translate said strategy into successful campaigns.
  • Proven track record of leading, motivating, and mentoring a team.
  • Knowledgeable about best practices relating to sales automation, as well as high-touch, personalized consumer sales efforts.
  • Experience managing a marketing budget to maximize ROI.
  • Experience working with HubSpot or similar inbound marketing automation tools (ConvertKit, InfusionSoft, Marketo).
  • Comfortable interpreting and succinctly communicating performance metrics for tests and campaigns.
  • Sound judgment, with a proven track record of using data to influence decision-making.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment and balancing multiple projects.
  • Willingness to do what it takes to get the job done, and an understanding that that often includes helping others with tasks not on your official job description.
  • Available to work a flexible range of hours that overlaps with standard business hours (9am-5pm) on US Eastern Time.
  • Access to a reliable, high-speed Internet connection.
Bonuses

  • Proven success in direct-to-consumer marketing, especially to women.
  • Experience working on an Agile or Scrum team, especially as Product Owner.
  • Experience working remotely with team members in different time zones.
Perks and Benefits

  • Flexible, remote work
  • Competitive benefits package, including fully covered health insurance for you and subsidized insurance for your family
  • Co-working stipend and other great perks
  • Free access to all the Skillcrush classes you can eat
  • A fun, passionate team working from all over the world
  • A fast-growing company with lots of opportunities for job growth
Pay Range

$80-90k, commensurate with skills and experience

About Skillcrush

Skillcrush is a rapidly growing online tech education company that offers online classes on a variety of technological topics.

At Skillcrush, we have built an open and cooperative environment. We hire who we want to work with, but also who think differently than us and challenge the status quo. We empower people, giving the support and autonomy needed to succeed. We embrace data to make decisions and overcome obstacles. We do what we do well, but we're always looking to do it better.

Skillcrush is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants regardless of their age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin (or current home base), sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, family status, time zone, geography, musical preferences, or college football allegiances. We think a diverse team builds a better product and a better company!

Although based in New York City, the Skillcrush team is a remote company and welcomes job applicants from all over the world.

How to Apply

We're excited that you're interested in this role at Skillcrush and we want to make sure your application gets the consideration it deserves. This means we can only accept your application via the link below. Please do not send your application materials or follow-ups to Skillcrush employees via email or social media.

And don't worry! We will consider and respond to every single application we get via this application form. So you’ll hear from us about the position either way, as soon as we've reviewed all applicants.

Apply for this position

https://skillcrush.breezy.hr/p/58b33c363426-director-of-sales-revenue?source=weworkremotely

items.title: Gotham Club: Sales Representative Position For Ambitious “A Player” At Nutrition Co.
items.content:
Sales Representative Position For Ambitious “A Player” At Nutrition Co.

Posted Jun 4

Gotham Club
Headquarters: New York,NY
https://gothamclubmedia.com/jobs-sales-rep/
View all Gotham Club jobs →

Are you an experienced Phone Sales Representative who loves working from the comfort of your own home? Have you dreamed of lending your expertise to build your dream position? Gotham Club Media wants to talk to you!

We’re looking to introduce a brand new Sales Representative role to our growing company. Our Sales Representative’s primary responsibility will be targeting people to buy our wildly successful Male Enhancement Supplements.

The Sales Representative will spend their time consulting with these potential customers over the phone and closing awesome deals. By utilizing a variety of Gotham’s services and products, sales representatives help our business increase and calibrate customer traffic.

The sales role - based anywhere in the US - is an inside sales position. Once you establish a level of productivity and command of the role, we will take your expertise into consideration on how we can expand it.

Responsibilities:

• Develop familiarity with each of our products and know how to sell them

• Contacting customers in all phases of the buying process, such as people who abandon the checkout process, are having trouble with getting credit card approval, or calling our inbound line to order.
• Utilize knowledge of your previous sales position to help us grow
• Consistently achieve and/or exceed sales targets
• Communicate with management about sales trends and offer suggestions to improve the sales process
• Strive for both gaining life-long customers and increasing revenue

Qualifications:

• 2+ years of proven success in a sales environment. Experience in the health and wellness industry or working with older men is a huge plus.

• Comfortable talking to men about sensitive subjects. A lot of our current online ads feature ADULT content and run on adult ad networks. Our newer products will not adult-centered.
• Experience selling over the phone and calling men in the US between the ages of 35-70 (these are never cold calls).
• A balance of coachability and confidence that makes people jealous at how great of a person you are
• You are adaptable and can think on your feet. When faced with new challenges, or tough conversations, you find creative ways to tackle them.
• You hold yourself accountable and balance multiple priorities like a tyrannosaurus rex on a tightrope

ABOUT THE POSITION:
  • Compensation: Negotiable
  • Hours: 9am – 5pm EST, Monday-Friday (semi-flexible)
  • Location: Remote work. You must be based in the US.
  • Our Team: We’re located in NYC and 25 strong, plus additional part-time employees.


Apply for this position

If you’d like to apply for this position, please write us an email with the headline “Look No Further! Your ‘A Player’ Sales Representative Is Here!” and in the email please include… Why are you leaving, or have left, your current position (if applicable)? (250 words max)Why are you an ideal fit for this position? (250 words max)What are your dreams and goals for your career in the next 2-5 years? (250 words max)Base + CommissionForward Submissions to jobs@gothamclubmedia.com

items.content:
This is a lead role to become a Senior Manager / Director in the company

Venturist is an end-to-end Growth Advisory Consultancy for Tech Startups and Corporate Startup Ventures. We believe that every company’s route to growth is different and one size does not fit all. Unlike traditional agencies within marketing, advertising, recruitment and training, Venturist takes an independent and unbiased approach to helping your new venture grow. The bottom line: We're here to guarantee and improved ROI. We exist to improve the way new ventures budget and hire for growth.

Working within the Digital Marketing side of the business, we’re looking for a sales/business development lead to spearhead all BD activities.

Reporting directly to the CEO, you’ll be responsible for driving all new Business Development activities.

While it’s primarily a new business focused role, you will be exposed to all aspects of the business including strategy and relationship management.

Duties / Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for the opening, closing and managing of campaigns

Your core focus will be centered around winning meetings with clients and attending them

You will be responsible for pipeline management, closing deals and bringing in revenue.

You will be working closely with the CEO and Business director on Strategy and direction of the business from a business development point of view.

You will be working closely with the marketing team on sales material, the deck and overall product.

You will be negotiating trial, test campaigns and closing deals

You will be required to manage the relationship with the client and share marketing reports with them, to ensure that they are more than happy with our service.

About you:

At least 3 years experience working within a digital agency working in business development

Key understanding of the processes involved in how to obtain marketing budget from clients.

Contacts and potential leads would be an advantage, but not essential.

All the skills associated with a great sales person: Driven, competitive, Hungry to succeed.

Superb Communication skills and likability

Excellent written skills

Super entrepreneurial: You will most likely be from a more established agency, who sees the benefit in joining a smaller agency where you will get exposure more of the managerial aspects of running a company as well as the seniority benefits.

Adaptable: This is a startup and as such there is no straight line to success. We’re always adapting and improving our processes, fast. So we need you to be able to adapt fast with us.

A personality. We’re a small team and a tight family. We’d say that we are a fun group, who are very social and are very well connected. This new hire will get exposure to all of this.

Just some of the benefits of Joining Venturist
Awesome office environment: fun, energetic and always something new and exciting.

Huge career acceleration: An opportunity to jump ahead in the ladder. You will be joining as employee no. 8-9, so great opportunity to become a director at such an early age in your career.

Huge learning potential and training. You be exposed to the daily activities of the senior management team and working alongside them.

Equity: You will be part of the early employee equity pool

Unlimited Holidays

Flexible working: You will be able to work from home for at least 1 day a week, and essentially manage your own schedule

Base salary with an excellent commission structure. Uncapped.

Cool offices. WeWork styled office, tea, coffee, fruit etc

Free Lunch Wednesdays, Drinks on Friday

Thanks for reading and we look forward to meeting you for a coffee!

NO PHONE CALLS, EMAILS, OR SOCIAL MEDIA MESSAGES: We love that you are enthusiastic and want to learn more about the job or the progress of your application. But please, no phone calls, emails, or social media messages. We only accept applications via our job website.

  • Are you a person that thrives on challenge and is excited when operating in the gray area?
  • Do you think it’s fun coming up with solutions to clients’ needs?
  • Do you possess loads of charm and quickly connect with anyone you meet?
  • Do you enjoy working with people who tell you how awesome you are when you hit your goals?
  • If you answered yes to all of these questions then we want you as our Part-time Sale Representative! 

JOB DUTIES

  • Communicate with prospective corporate clients via calls and email. Determine client needs and communicate how one of our tours solves that problem
  • Put together proposals and follow up as necessary
  • Manage pipeline with our CRM
  • Meet monthly sales goals
  • Work with our Scheduling and VIP departments to successful transition the sales to operations
  • Other duties as assigned
 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 1 year previous B2B sales & customer service experience
  • You have a home office and prior experience working remotely (or great self management skills)
  • Available to work scheduled shifts between 9am and 8pm ET
  • Available to work ~1 weekend a month
  • Must have nearly perfect written English skills and amazingly awesome spoken English skills
  • High quality work: You are an efficient individual who makes projects happen behind the scenes with a fine eye for details (in short: you get shit done)
  • Technically inclined, able to pick up new things quickly: we use a lot of web-based services (including, but not limited to: Google Docs, Gmail, Google Calendar, Slack, Xero, PandaDoc, Base CRM)
  • Flexibility quotient high: Things can and do change on a dime around here -- you gotta go with the flow, and be ready to kick it into high gear at a moment's notice
  • Be fun and exciting without using too many exclamation marks!!!!!!!!!
  • Have regular access to reliable wifi and a personal computer 
  • Authorized to work in the US
 

HOURS / PAY RATE

  • Flexibility to work as needed from 9am to 8pm Eastern Monday - Friday + ~1 weekend a month
  • Part time, about 29 hours per week
  • $15 per hour + monthly commission
 

MORE INFO

  • Many people on our team are remote and work from home
  • Sales Reps occasionally receive performance-based rewards and incentives
  • Find out more about us by watching our Founder Nick's Tedx Talk
 

NO PHONE CALLS, EMAILS, OR SOCIAL MEDIA MESSAGES: We love that you are enthusiastic and want to learn more about the job or the progress of your application. But please, no phone calls, emails, or social media messages. We only accept applications via our job website.

Today, more than 4 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. items.content:
US Campaign Manager

Posted May 17

Sumofus
Headquarters: New York, NY USA
https://www.sumofus.org/about/jobs/
View all Sumofus jobs →

Summary

SumOfUs is hiring a Campaign Manager to help lead our digital campaigning. This is a full-time position based anywhere in the United States. The ideal candidate has 4-6 years of strategic campaigning experience, including at least 2 years of experience in digital campaigning. If you love leading diverse distributed teams and you’re bursting with new ideas for mobilizing massive numbers of people to fight corporate power, then this is the role for you. Applications close 11:59 pm Eastern Standard Time on Friday June 22.

A bit about us

SumOfUs is a community of people from around the world committed to curbing the growing power of corporations. We want to buy from, work for and invest in companies that respect the environment, treat their workers well and respect democracy. The biggest corporations in the world rely on ordinary people to keep them in business. We are their customers, their employees, and often their investors. When we act together, we can be more powerful than they are. Together, our community of millions act as a global consumer watchdog – running and winning campaigns to hold the biggest companies in the world accountable.

What you’ll do as part of our team

  • Develop and execute winning campaign strategies for fighting corporate power in the US and around the world;

  • Lead the US regional team with support and oversight from a Campaign Director to achieve impact, fundraising, and organizational goals;

  • Supervise, mentor and train campaigners;

  • Write and edit action and fundraising mailings and social media content that motivate SumOfUs members and help win campaigns; and

  • Help craft compelling narratives that engage our members in an empowering story of fighting corporate power.

Skills and experiences you’ll need to bring

We have no formal education requirements – if you take on the role and are willing to grow with it, that’s all that matters. This role requires you to be:

  • Experienced with digital-first models of campaigning;

  • A fantastic manager of staff and leader of teams (bonus points for managing teams remotely);

  • Demonstrably able to develop and lead impactful and innovative campaign strategies across at least two issues areas (e.g. access to health care and climate change);

  • Experienced building effective partnerships with advocacy and activist groups;

  • Have a deep understanding of the US political context;

  • Multi-talented and willing to learn and do anything to see the job through;

  • Comfortable in fast-moving work environments;

  • Dedicated to building a fairer and more sustainable global economy;

  • An excellent writer and communicator;

  • An enthusiastic technologist and experimenter; and

  • Fluent in written and oral English.

Big pluses

We don't expect you to have all of these! A strong candidate will likely have 2 or 3 of them.

  • Proficiency in major world languages other than English -- especially Spanish (native-level fluency is even better!);

  • Experience managing a large email list (100,000+ subscribers);

  • Experience with using digital tools (e.g. P2P texting) and tactics for online/offline distributed organizing and mobilization;

  • Experience with online fundraising;

  • Experience working closely with communities affected by corporate accountability issues -- from indigenous communities to low-wage workers;

  • Experience working in or closely with the labor movement and/or shareholder activism  movements in the US;

  • Knowledge of and relationships with policy experts and campaigning groups in key issue areas like ethics of technology companies re: human rights and privacy, tax justice, workers’ rights, agribusiness, climate change, the global financial system, and trade;

  • Experience with market campaigns or corporate accountability issues;

  • Experience working closely with decision-makers at multinational corporations in a CSR context;

  • Deep understanding of the operations, structures, regulations, and incentives within a key industry or corporate sector -- technology, finance, agriculture, etc.;

  • Experience living or working in multiple regions of the world;

  • Experience working with mobile technology and user interfaces;

  • Experience using SQL and data and experimentation tools (e.g. Optimizely), ideally in a campaigning environment.

Further details

Compensation is competitive and will be determined based on a combination of experience and cost-of-living in the region you live in (for some context: for qualified applicants, this position in New York City will pay between approximately $72,000 and $80,000).

We offer significant benefits, including the ability to work from home or a co-working space, flexibility to set your own hours, five weeks vacation time per year, additional paid-sick leave, paid parental leave, private health insurance, and opportunities to travel internationally. This position will report to the Campaign Director with oversight of the US regional team. The successful candidate would be a member of the staff union and subject to the terms of the bargaining contract between IFPTE Local 70 and SumOfUs.

SumOfUs is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of SumOfUs to provide equal employment opportunity to all applicants for employment and employees and not to discriminate because of race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, marital status, personal appearance, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, matriculation, genetic information, or political affiliation. Equal employment opportunities will be provided in employment, recruitment, selection, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, layoff, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.

People from communities that traditionally experience discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity or immigration status; women; people with disabilities; trans, non-binary and genderqueer people; and LGBQA people are especially encouraged to apply.


Apply for this position

Please use the form at https://www.sumofus.org/about/jobs/#op-254496-us-campaign-manager and follow the instructions there.

items.content:
Account Executive- USA

Posted May 16

ScheduleOnce
Headquarters: California
www.scheduleonce.com
View all ScheduleOnce jobs →

We are searching for highly analytical individuals with a demonstrated interest in technology to join our growing Sales team. An ideal candidate should be a fast learner and be able to understand complex systems. We are looking for someone who thinks independently, complies with standards, and maintains the highest levels of transparency and work ethic.

No previous sales experience is required. We are looking for qualities, not experience. You will need to demonstrate a history of excellence and commitment in all fields to which you applied yourself. Working for us, you will have the opportunity to learn new sales, business and technical skills. As our company grows, so will your opportunities. You will contribute to the exchange of ideas while we constantly work to advance our product.

We work 100% remotely, each team member from their own home. Our employees work full-time salaried positions with a complete benefits package (health/dental insurance, 401K, vacation/sick days).

Salary: $25K- $30K yearly salary 

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate new sales opportunities via email, telephone, and online meetings

  • Maintain and follow sales procedures

  • Contribute to the improvement of the sales process

  • Develop long-lasting customer relationships and nurture current relationships

  • Act as a trusted advisor to new and prospective customers

  • Review customer requirements to provide the optimal solution for their organization

  • Troubleshoot technical issues and communicate with customers

  • Stay up-to-date by reading technical articles and receiving training for new features

Please ensure you can work the below full-time shift before applying:

10AM-6PM US PST

The shift is full-time, Monday-Friday. The above eight-hour shift would be your usual schedule but more time may be required depending on daily circumstances.

Requirements:

  • Excellent organization skills, attention to detail, and customer focused

  • Analytical mindset with ability to quickly recognize patterns  

  • Able to master new software and systems quickly

  • Superb writing and communication skills: accurate, focused, and detailed

  • Productive and excellent at multitasking

  • Strong interpersonal and numerical skills

  • Completion of courses or a degree in a relevant field (mathematics, computer science, linguistics, IT, physics, biology, chemistry, etc.)

 

Apply for this position

cs-hr@scheduleonce.com

items.title: Gotham Club: Sales Representative Position For Ambitious “A Player” At Nutrition Co.
items.content:
Sales Representative Position For Ambitious “A Player” At Nutrition Co.

Posted May 15

Gotham Club
Headquarters: New York,NY
https://gothamclubmedia.com/jobs-sales-rep/
View all Gotham Club jobs →

Are you an experienced Phone Sales Representative who loves working from the comfort of your own home? Have you dreamed of lending your expertise to build your dream position? Gotham Club Media wants to talk to you! 

We’re looking to introduce a brand new Sales Representative role to our growing company. Our Sales Representative’s primary responsibility will be targeting people to buy our wildly successful Male Enhancement Supplements. 

The Sales Representative will spend their time consulting with these potential customers over the phone and closing awesome deals. By utilizing a variety of Gotham’s services and products, sales representatives help our business increase and calibrate customer traffic.

The sales role - based anywhere in the US - is an inside sales position. Once you establish a level of productivity and command of the role, we will take your expertise into consideration on how we can expand it. 

Responsibilities:

• Develop familiarity with each of our products and know how to sell them
• Contacting customers in all phases of the buying process, such as people who abandon the checkout process, are having trouble with getting credit card approval, or calling our inbound line to order.
• Utilize knowledge of your previous sales position to help us grow
• Consistently achieve and/or exceed sales targets
• Communicate with management about sales trends and offer suggestions to improve the sales process
• Strive for both gaining life-long customers and increasing revenue

Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree preferred
• 2+ years of proven success in a sales environment. Experience in the health and wellness industry or working with older men is a huge plus.
• Comfortable talking to men about sensitive subjects. A lot of our current online ads feature ADULT content and run on adult ad networks. Our newer products will not adult-centered.
• Experience selling over the phone and calling men in the US between the ages of 35-70 (these are never cold calls).
• A balance of coachability and confidence that makes people jealous at how great of a person you are
• You are adaptable and can think on your feet. When faced with new challenges, or tough conversations, you find creative ways to tackle them.
• You hold yourself accountable and balance multiple priorities like a tyrannosaurus rex on a tightrope

TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION:
If you’d like to apply for this position, please write us an email with the headline “Look No Further! Your ‘A Player’ Sales Representative Is Here!” and in the email please include…

Why are you leaving, or have left, your current position (if applicable)? (250 words max)
Why are you an ideal fit for this position? (250 words max)
What are your dreams and goals for your career in the next 2-5 years? (250 words max)

Salary: Base + Commission (To be determined by experience)

ABOUT THE POSITION:
Compensation: Negotiable
Hours: 9am – 5pm EST, Monday-Friday (semi-flexible)
Location: Remote work. You must be based in the US. 
Our Team: We’re located in NYC and 25 strong, plus additional part-time employees.

Apply for this position

TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION:If you’d like to apply for this position, please write us an email with the headline “Look No Further! Your ‘A Player’ Sales Representative Is Here!” and in the email please include…Why are you leaving, or have left, your current position (if applicable)? (250 words max)Why are you an ideal fit for this position? (250 words max)What are your dreams and goals for your career in the next 2-5 years? (250 words max)

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are Resi. The straight-forward modern architect.

We believe in making world-class residential architecture accessible to all. Through our use of technology, we can offer a high quality and cost-effective service right across the UK.

Working here, you’ll discover that we do things a little differently to our competitors. We’re looking to shake up the architecture industry and so need an ambitious, no-holds-barred team to make this happen.

We have a fun, dynamic team, located in Bermondsey (though we’re moving to Elephant & Castle soon). Currently, we’re a small team of under 30, but we’re growing quickly and on the hunt for someone with a bit of hustle to join our business development team. Nope not cold calling. You help answer questions that homeowners might have before they commission us to undertake their project.

Most companies say they are an equal opportunities employer, but we really mean it. We are led by a female CEO and a female CTO. We actively encourage people who feel like they don’t fit the traditional stereotypes to apply. Your experience is all that matters.

Experience
• Likes helping people and talking
• Can hustle or put differently, can build rapport with people - we don't like the hard sell
• 1-2 years sales experience (in any setting)
• Can write well
• Is diligent and hardworking
• Has a thirst for knowledge and picks things up quickly

Desirable but not essential:
• Has studied architecture (or even incomplete) or some form of construction experience
• Understands or has experience working on a building site, the lifecycle of a house extension (maybe you have done one) in an architecture firm or as a supplier (could be flooring / glazing / kitchens)

What we offer: 
• A good London-based salary
• Commission
• The opportunity for rapid progress
• Ownership of your work & area
• On the job training
• 30 days holiday (inc Bank Holidays)
• The chance to help build a company from the ground up

All applications should include a CV and a cover letter/email as to why you think you would be a good fit for Resi

items.title: Freedom Formula: Affiliate Management Ninja
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=12, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Affiliate Management Ninja

Posted May 9

Freedom Formula
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://freedom-formula.breezy.hr/p/50d152dfd113-affiliate-management-ninja?source=weworkremotely
View all Freedom Formula jobs →

You like your commute, right?
How about dressing fancy to impress your boss...?

Would you rather have the freedom to work from home or travel with a kickass job... while rocking your comfiest sweatpants (or even pajamas - no judgment!)...?

Hallelujah! Get in here. And close the door behind you.

Hi I’m Evan - Co-Founder here at Freedom Formula. And my partner and I are running a small tribe on a mission to change lives.

But that’s enough about me for now. Let’s talk about you...

Do you want to help 1 million people get out of jobs they hate by fostering amazing relationships with influencers and badasses around the world?

How do you feel about taking on big ambiguous ideas and running full speed with them - turning them into a flawless system that creates constant growth?

Do you consider yourself resourceful, a quick proactive learner? Someone with the desire to quickly catapult a small tribe from cult following to international movement?

Are you looking to work with a group of rockstars all around the world, while becoming the best in the world at attracting affiliates, growing an online business and cultivating amazing relationships by over-delivering 100% of the time - one of THE most profitable skills in the world today…?

How would you like a bunch of responsibility and autonomy in a rapidly growing business, where your expertise is not only valued, but embraced as a lynchpin in our business’s success?

What about a remote workplace that doesn’t get bogged down in corporate BS and certifications - whose ONLY focus as a group is getting results toward our crazy ambitious objectives and having fun...

Well good news! We are looking for a badass affiliate manager to help us soundly and systematically conquer the world... and save millions of people from giving up 65 years of their life to jobs they don’t love.

Someone that will quickly become one of the world’s best accelerating business growth and defeating what some might call “crazy” goals... with ease.

A lot of people call this an Affiliate Manager, Affiliate Marketing Specialist, or something like that…

And honestly - I did it too, because it’s the terminology that you’re familiar with…

But now that we are friends... I feel like I can tell you - we don’t call it any of these things…

We call it our Growth Specialist.

Because millions of people can “manage affiliates…”

But it takes a real rockstar to be the rocket fuel shooting a business to the moon… And that’s what we are looking for.

Alright, let’s talk nitty gritty.

Keep reading if you don’t hate baby turtles...

WHO ARE WE, YOU ASK?

We run a really fast-growing company called Freedom Formula, where we help people create their first online business, fire their boss, and live the life that they actually want to live.

And we are searching for the next rockstar to add to our tribe.

9-5 is a curse word in our company, and suggesting cubicles might just get you tarred and feathered.

We help people travel the world and spend more time with the people that mean most to them. Curious about what we do? Check us out here.

At the end of the day though, we're a small tribe of really smart and talented rockstars who are working together toward a common goal.

But what is that goal..?

To completely transform the way people look at jobs they don’t love and entrepreneurship in America and around the world... And allow people to spend their life doing what they actually want to do… Instead of surrendering 65 years because ‘that’s just how life works’

Our entire tribe is remote, so you get to work from anywhere. We are innovating left and right and we do work that changes lives.

We work hard, get stuff done and are insanely informal.

Don't believe me? What if we did a perfect lobster walk?


BOOM. 10/10 Crustacean Shuffle.

Anyway... Back to the good stuff.

We deliver an amazing product to help all of our students and are doing an amazing job at marketing and changing people’s lives... which has allowed us to grow really fast.

But, because of all the growth, some of us have gotten way too busy… Which is where you come in… If you want to go fast.

"I wanna go fast"

-Ricky Bobby

THIS IS FOR YOU IF:

  • You have an in-depth knowledge of (or crazy desire to learn) how to create the world’s biggest baddest affiliate program
  • You can consistently pick out patterns in what is working, what is not, and why
  • You are process and systems driven
  • You are able to proactively meet and help a team exceed deadlines by working ahead of schedule and spotting issues before they happen
  • You are competitive, and love to be the underdog
  • You have a desire to help people literally transform their lives
  • You are borderline obsessive about learning - constantly seeking out more books and courses that will help you grow and improve at your role.
  • You implement consistently with very little direction - doing your own research to solve problems on your own.
  • Lastly - you have an unquestioned work ethic. You aren’t afraid of hard work, because you know that it is the key to true sustainable growth... In fact - you have a very strong desire to hustle, and put in extra time and learn in your off hours.
WHO WE ARE AND ARE NOT FOR:

If you question your will to work hard, more than the normal 8-4 or 9-5 days, this probably isn’t the best position to apply for.

We hate normal jobs, and the 9-5 grind.

But when you chase real, enormous goals… There is lots of real hustle involved to make them a reality.

We have big, scary goals, and are surrounding ourselves with a small tribe of rockstars that are as excited as we are about the goal, so that there is no such thing as ‘work’. We enjoy every minute of it, and want the same for all our tribemates.

So keep reading if you don’t hate lemurs (everybody loves lemurs…)

BUT EVAN - WHAT WILL I BE WORKING ON?

Great question Mr. or Ms. Reader… And thank you for asking it! Let’s jump into the shoes of this role for a second: .

  • Finding the best ways to connect and stand out with some of the best entrepreneurs and influencers in the world
  • Managing dozens of conversations at once, and moving each prospective affiliate from interested to ecstatic, repeat endorser of our business. Evangelists, some would say :)
  • Finding what each affiliate’s audience wants, and helping customize amazing content that will inspire them to take action on FBA and creating their dream life
  • Suggesting and implementing new processes and systems to help make achieving our goals simpler or easier in the future
  • Constantly learning from the best and working to identify weak places in our affiliate program, and designing ways to immediately fix them
  • Basically - adding jet fuel to our rocket to help us get in front of 10 million people, and change 1 million lives.
Because we are growing insanely fast and we want to keep a very small tribe of rockstars - this will be an outrageous learning and growth opportunity for the person who fits into the glass slipper.

WHAT WE DO AND DON’T CARE ABOUT

  • You have the ability and desire to quickly go full-time once you knock our socks off.
  • Age and experience does not matter. While a firm understanding of online marketing and affiliate/influencer marketing is helpful - we are looking more for qualities...
  • These qualities are humble, hungry, smart, and entrepreneurial...
  • And most importantly - a very quick learner who is wakes up excited to learn and grow.
INTERESTED?

You’re one smart cookie, my friend.

If you’re interested, here’s what to do next.

Because we get a LOT of applications for these roles, and we take getting rockstars seriously… All applications will go through a healthy vetting process and filtered through our hiring stages.

If this sounds awesome and you’re serious about this, please show it. If you’re not - please don’t bother applying.

“If you got it, flaunt it.”

- Beyonce

The first step is to fill out the application questionnaire on the next page.

If you do it right and we like your application, you’ll get into round 2 with further instructions.

Good luck and I hope to talk to you soon!

Evan

Freedom Formula

Apply for this position

https://freedom-formula.breezy.hr/p/50d152dfd113-affiliate-management-ninja?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
Part-time Sales Representative (Remote)

Posted May 7

Museum Hack
Headquarters: New York, NY
http://jobs.museumhack.com/apply/FY6NAgDAHW/Parttime-Sales-Representative-Remote?source=WWR
View all Museum Hack jobs →

NO PHONE CALLS, EMAILS, OR SOCIAL MEDIA MESSAGES: We love that you are enthusiastic and want to learn more about the job or the progress of your application. But please, no phone calls, emails, or social media messages. We only accept applications via our job website.
  • Are you a person that thrives on challenge and is excited when operating in the gray area?
  • Do you think it’s fun coming up with solutions to clients’ needs?
  • Do you possess loads of charm and quickly connect with anyone you meet?
  • Do you enjoy working with people who tell you how awesome you are when you hit your goals?
  • If you answered yes to all of these questions then we want you as our Part-time Sale Representative!

ABOUT US

Museum Hack is a non-traditional private tour company crafting museum experiences that encourage visitors to look at museums in new ways. We use the expansive collection of the museums we work in as our playground to create “un-highlights” tours that focus on hidden works and unexpected stories. We’re a creative company that offers irreverent, renegade museum tours and cultural offsites to corporate and private clients.

Founded in 2013 and having grown to over $2 million in sales in 2017, We’ve uplifted the lives of tens of thousands of new museum guests. We work at renowned cultural institutions and quirky locations in New York City and other major cities to bring these innovative experiences to companies and groups.

Museum Hack has been featured by The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, PBS, TimeOut New York, Huffington Post, TEDx, and more. Beloved clients include private citizens, schools, industry groups, and large companies like Google, Lego, LinkedIn, and CitiBank.

And we’re looking to add another Client Advisor to our sales team!

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Communicate with prospective corporate clients via calls and email. Determine client needs and communicate how one of our tours solves that problem
  • Put together proposals and follow up as necessary
  • Manage pipeline with our CRM
  • Meet monthly sales goals
  • Work with our Scheduling and VIP departments to successful transition the sales to operations
  • Other duties as assigned
 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 1 year previous B2B sales & customer service experience
  • You have a home office and prior experience working remotely (or great self management skills)
  • Available to work scheduled shifts between 9am and 8pm ET
  • Available to work ~1 weekend a month
  • Must have nearly perfect written English skills and amazingly awesome spoken English skills
  • High quality work: You are an efficient individual who makes projects happen behind the scenes with a fine eye for details (in short: you get shit done)
  • Technically inclined, able to pick up new things quickly: we use a lot of web-based services (including, but not limited to: Google Docs, Gmail, Google Calendar, Slack, Xero, PandaDoc, Base CRM)
  • Flexibility quotient high: Things can and do change on a dime around here -- you gotta go with the flow, and be ready to kick it into high gear at a moment's notice
  • Be fun and exciting without using too many exclamation marks!!!!!!!!!
  • Have regular access to reliable wifi and a personal computer 
  • Authorized to work in the US
 

HOURS / PAY RATE

  • Flexibility to work as needed from 9am to 8pm Eastern Monday - Friday + ~1 weekend a month
  • Part time, about 29 hours per week
  • $15 per hour + monthly commission
 

MORE INFO

  • Many people on our team are remote and work from home

items.content:
Job Description - Business Development / Partnerships Manager

*Intro/Background*
Impala is hiring a Business Development associate to build a network of partnerships that are key for our business.

Impala is the universal API for hotel data. We build connections/partnerships with hotel core systems (Property Management Systems (PMS)). Bringing these PMS onboard as partners is the core component to our business.

You’d be joining a rapidly expanding and well funded company that is solving the data problem in the $1.6tn travel industry.

*Job Role*
As a Business Development / Partnerships Manager, you’re focus will be bringing these PMS onto the Impala platform. This directly includes:

* Sourcing and outreaching to new potential partners
* Incentivising and pushing through deals
* Negotiating on partnership details
* Closing partnership deals
* Maintaining close relationships with each partner

You will be expected to report frequent updates on progress with every partner deal.

*Key Requirements*
* A 2:1 degree from a good university or equivalent demonstration of intellectual ability
* Previous working experience at a technology start-up or small/medium sized company
* A significant understanding of technology (not MS Word)
* Partnership/Sales Experience (at least 2 years)
* Ability to work remote
* Ability to travel

*Favourable Attributes*
* Previous experience with high value accounts
* Previous experience in travel/hospitality technology
* Previous experience in deep technology sales

*Remuneration*
This position will be remunerated via a base salary, and a heavily weighted commission structure. As an early employee at Impala, you will also be offered stock options in the company.

_Base Salary - Up to £20,000 p/a_
_OTE - Up to £38,000 p/a_

*Benefits*
Because Impala is a fully remote company, Impalans work from wherever they are (so long as they’re within Western Europe). We provide a stipend which ensures that either you have a fully equipped home office or an office in a local co-working space that works for you.

As part of the job role, you may be required to travel to meet partners, to attend important industry conferences. These would most likely be Europe based.

* You’ll get a hardware budget for buying your own equipment.
* You’ll be a part of a company that puts professional development squarely front and centre.
* You’ll attend frequent team meetings and gatherings across Europe (last time in Potsdam, this time in Amsterdam).

items.content:
Sales Account Executive

Posted May 2

CG Cookie
Headquarters: Geneva, IL
http://cgcookie.com
View all CG Cookie jobs →

WHO ARE WE
CG Cookie is an online subscription-based school for digital artists. We are a small enthusiastic crew committed to building a company we’re all proud to work for while being a force for good in the community.

For the past 10 years, our online platform CGcookie.com has offered affordable education for game developers and animation artists. We educate them through videos, live classes and resources, though our goal is to go a few steps further by also operating a thriving online community and empowering artists by showing them how to turn their hobby into a career.

While the majority of our members are individual digital artists, we also offer group subscriptions to CG Cookie to schools (and studios) teaching Game Development, or 3D Animation programs. Educators use our platform as in-class resources or as material that supplements their own curriculum.

Geneva, IL is CG Cookie’s mothership, with a team in 15 cities around this pale blue dot. This means that 90% of our communication happens online.

We are humans building platforms to help others succeed, connected by the persistent nature to overcome challenges, obsessed with improvement and creating solutions that didn’t exist yesterday.

WHO ARE YOU
An honest, ambitious, empathetic person who is comfortable with the unknown.

As a sales account executive for group sales of CG Cookie subscription to schools, you will be the voice of CG Cookie and have a direct impact on the growth of the company. You will be responsible for identifying, contacting and closing new group accounts, with focus on adding genuine value and crafting long-lasting partnerships.

You have experience with sales in the education sector and know the singularities of navigating a higher education space. You enjoy talking to people on the phone, have great communications skills and can stay organized while managing dozens of active leads.

Do you like solving problems? Have you been an educator or spent time in career services at a higher education university? Love the work of outreach and sales? If you answered yes, we should talk.

DAILY RESPONSIBILITIES
We are a small company, which means you’ll be wearing multiple hats, with a few primary responsibilities:

  • Identifying, contact and close new group accounts with a focus on educational institutions. You’ll be measured on how many accounts you close
  • Maintain positive relationships with existing group subscribers through email, phone, and CG Cookie website
  • Design and perform outreach activities to leads such as video live streams, webinars, email, phone and attend 1-2 trade shows a year
  • Communicate with the CG Cookie team through Basecamp, Slack, and Intercom.

REQUIREMENTS AND 1-UPS

  • 1+ years of experience in education sales or outreach roles (K-6 through K-12 and higher ed preferred)
  • Though you are not expected to be a digital artist, an active interest in the creative digital industry is preferred
  • A positive attitude and willingness to tackle unforeseen problems
  • Entrepreneurial approach and an ability to determine the highest-impact activities of each day
  • If not located in the Chicagoland area, ~99% of your work will be remote, which means online communication skills and patience are a must.
  • Must reside within the United States

BENEFITS
We strive for CG Cookie be your dream job, a place where you can hang your hat for years to come.

  • Base Salary + Tiered Commision
  • Ability to work anywhere in the world, as long as you have a strong internet connection
  • Exceptionally friendly and supportive team that loves working together
  • Full coverage for medical, dental, and vision for you and your family
  • Simple IRA Retirement with a matching contribution of 3%
  • 4-day work week (32hrs)
  • Annual Employee Bonus Plan
  • Minimum Vacation Policy - Required to take at least 12 days PTO per year.

Apply for this position

Apply at https://goo.gl/forms/INkBCPU6Wv6YmVTZ2

items.title: Affiliate Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*DESCRIPTION*

We’re looking for an empathetic and analytical affiliate manager to help us rapidly grow the world’s first consumer brand in death.

Working directly with our Head of Growth, you’ll win new partners and develop current relationships.

Our current partners include a number of household names, and there is significant opportunity for growth across multiple different verticals.

*ABOUT FAREWILL*

At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.

We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK.

Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our customer reviews) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and by the BBC. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £41 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.

*OUR TEAM*

We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.

Based in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Zoopla and Wonga, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, and The Daily Mail Group.

This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.

You can find out more about our team here: https://farewill.com/about

*ABOUT YOU*

We’re looking for someone who loves making and building mutually beneficial relationships. Our partner possibilities are endless, so you’ll need to be able to reason where the greatest potential lies.

You should have roots in digital affiliates but have the ability to apply that logic to offline partners too.

Key responsibilities:

Formulate partner target list
Lead partnerships pitches
Build partnership collateral and proposals
Nurture and optimise current relationships
Analyse and report on partner performance
Manage budgets and report on targets

*REQUIREMENTS*

2+ years in affiliate management
Great communication, listening and negotiation skills
Excellent ability to empathise with partner needs
Proven track record in building and managing high volume partnerships, both via networks and direct
Ability to analyse and optimise affiliate performance
Autonomous and resourceful with the ability to own projects end to end

*NICE TO HAVE*

Experience of working in a startup
Good knowledge of Google analytics

*BENEFITS*

A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths
Influence, trust, and impact inside a well-funded startup that's scaling
Work alongside other friendly, passionate and talented people
Competitive salary
Lovely, bright office in Haggerston near the canal, and a stone’s throw from Shoreditch
Choose your own equipment
Support and opportunities to grow through dedicated time and resources to learn
Regular off-site days and team lunches
Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
25 days holiday leave, not including public holidays
If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you.

We are an equal opportunity employer and highly value diversity at our company.

*OUR HIRING PROCESS*

Inviting someone to join our team is a big deal for us and we put a lot of time and effort into the process. If we figure out we’re not perfect for each other at any stage we’ll let you know as soon as possible. Here’s how it’ll look for the person joining us:

Send us your CV along with maximum 150 words cover letter on why this role is perfect for you.

We’ll invite you for a 20 minute phone call or video call to learn more about your goals and experience. You’ll also be able to ask questions about Farewill and the role.

We’ll then give you an exercise that is relevant to the role, and run a more detailed interview in person to hear more about you and your experience. We will make sure this is at a time that is convenient for you.

If everyone’s happy, most importantly you, we’ll make you an offer to join our team.

*Closing date: 15th May 2018*

items.title: Sales Manager or Director, K12 & Assessment (Remote)
items.content:
Sales Manager or Director, K12 & Assessment (Remote) - Jobmote

Sales Manager or Director, K12 & Assessment (Remote)

Confidential Company

Primary Purpose
The Sales Manager or Director (DOE) is responsible for executing the sales strategy for our K12 and Assessment market, through prospecting, leads management, closing new business opportunities
and scaling the account potential. Candidates must have experience presenting compelling and winning value propositions to prospective clients. Excellent selling skills and understanding of sales
processes, especially software services sales - selling services unlike selling products, essentially focusing on selling capability, process and custom solutions that meet the customer needs. Candidates
must be well versed with such processes. Performs sales presentations, promotions, trade shows, seminars and various sales related duties necessary to achieve maximum sales.

Essential Functions
* Study the target list, identify prospects and validate leads
* Make contact with prospects, familiarize them with the company* s services and solutions capability
* Identify potential requirements and additional leads within an account
* Define individual customer sales strategy and collaborate with sales head, business heads, industry experts in the customer acquisition process
* Engage prospects to sell services such as online educational product development, design, engineering and support, content management, enterprise solutions, editorial services, and QA services
* Work closely with senior management to drive sales and manage relationships
* Create pipeline of opportunities, manage funnel, engage in presales, and identify new prospects
* Other duties upon request

Key Responsibilities
* Collaborate with teams, onsite and offshore
* Collaborate with inside sales team and research team
* Achieve quota assigned for prospecting, client conversions on a monthly basis
* Achieve quote for order book on a monthly basis
* Exceed annual goals and targets
* Manage forecast and sales pipeline reporting, on a regular basis

Qualifications
* Bachelor* s Degree in marketing, communications, business or a related field.
* 5 years* experience in Software Services sales in the education technology and curriculum services in the K12 & Assessment market.
* Existing executive relations with Textbook publishers, Assessment Companies or Digital Learning products companies will be a preference. Understanding education publishing a plus.
* Experience working with offshore resources and coordinating with internal teams for solutions. *
* Experience in software development processes, e-learning products, digital content
* Excellent selling skills and understanding of sales processes, especially software services sales
* Awareness on the key trends in the industry, the challenges, how the market is reacting.
* Excellent analytical skills and consultative selling ability. Manage client expectations, understand client requirements, manage the bid process with sales support, and enable a winning bid
* Mine new accounts with cross selling and up selling opportunities.
* Highly motivated with excellent verbal and written communication, presentation and problem solving skills.
* Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes.
* Excellent hunting skills in potential accounts that will have multiple buyers interested in a wide array of services that our company provides.
* Willingness and ability to work flexible hours and travel (up to 60%); will include some overnight travel. Must live in proximity to a large airport to facilitate travel.
* Proficient in modern business tools, sales CRMs, communication tools, mobile tools, presentation tools. - provided by Dice Sales Manager or Director, K12 & Assessment
