items.content:
POSITION: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
LOCATION: Farringdon, London
REPORTING TO: Chief Commercial Officer

DevicePilot

OVERVIEW
Founded in the UK in 2015, DevicePilot is the business-critical tool for any scaling connected product company with customers ranging from electric vehicle charging and food waste management through to smart thermostats and beyond. We are a small team with a huge amount of experience in IoT, with even bigger ambitions for DevicePilot!

Join us as we embark on our journey to scale quickly, help define the IoT market and create a brand new product category.

THE OPPORTUNITY: SALES DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE

What You’ll do
-Research and build lists of prospect customers that fit our pre-determined ‘ideal customer’ profile
-Conduct initial sales qualification via phone and email to generate ‘Sales Qualified Leads’ (SQLs) to be handed over to the sales team
-Own and develop customer profiles based on the knowledge you will develop through research and contact, use this to keep marketing, sales and exec team updated
-Work creatively to identify new sources of leads, make recommendations of new sales/marketing activities that could bolster lead gen
-Primary point of contact for any external lead gen activities- running daily reviews and ensuring a high ROI as well as continuous feedback loop of learnings back into the business

THE RIGHT CANDIDATE: REQUIREMENTS

-Evidence of an entrepreneurial/sales mindset- this doesn’t have to be direct sales experience, but you will have countless examples where you have hustled your way in (or out) of things!
-Self-starter, high energy, someone who is actively looking for and will be motivated by being part of growing a business with an enormous market opportunity
-A natural communicator and relationship builder
-Excellent written and verbal English
-Ability to learn and adapt quickly, work independently and think creatively
Good listener, strong verbal and written communication skills
A team player with a ‘can do’ attitude where you are always happy to roll up your sleeves and get stuck into a task that helps the business achieve it’s goals
-Motivated by the prospects of a career and not just a job- the possibilities for strong performers to take on additional responsibilities and get promoted are endless- this is the very best place to accelerate your skills and experience
-Preferable but not essential- experience of using CRM, a proven track record of attaining/exceeding targets
Bachelor’s degree desirable

WHY DevicePilot? BENEFITS & PERKS
-Be one of the early team members- that means you’ll help influence and shape the company culture with plenty of opportunities for career growth
-Work alongside team members who have built companies that ship billions of units, have worked with some of the world’s largest blue-chip customers and have achieved 9-figure ‘exits’
-Based in our central London office within walking distance of some of the best food markets in the city
Stock options- we want you to be invested in us

items.title: BuySellAds: Account Operations
items.content:
Full-time

(Brooklyn, NY or Remote)

About us:

BuySellAds transformed the way advertising was transacted online with the introduction of its Marketplace in 2008. BuySellAds’ advertising technology platform provides advertisers with direct access to the industry’s top performing display, native, dedicated email, and sponsored content inventory. Our platform empowers both advertisers and publishers by bridging the ad tech divide. Today, we work with more than 12,000 advertisers and help them connect with the internet’s most passionate audiences. We are a remote company that primarily works around an EST schedule.

 

 

Description:

BSA is looking for a full-time Account Operations team member to support its growing revenue team. This position requires a passion for media and advertising, a strong willingness to learn and a sharp attention to detail. The AM will be responsible for managing campaigns through the post-sales cycle and will be our liaison between a lovely group of Publishers, our internal Sales team, and Advertisers. The ideal candidate will have experience in digital advertising and be able to translate client goals and objectives into effective online advertising experiences. You are THE most organized person on the planet. You can turn chaos into clarity. Your spreadsheets love you. Your customers love you.

 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the sales team to execute and manage campaigns on key publisher partners like Digg.com, Pocket and Dribbble
  • Own the entire ad execution processes for assigned accounts (campaign strategization, asset management, proofing, implementation, performance optimization, reporting and evaluation) 
  • Work in tandem with the ad operations team to ensure campaigns are executed on schedule and performing their best
  • Collaborate with Account Executives and Creative Leads to execute campaigns that meet client objectives and timelines
  • Build rapport with some of our top publisher partners while helping us ensure their success
  • Have a “whatever it takes” mentality when it comes to customer and company success and take the initiative to improve and streamline processes wherever possible

 

Qualifications:

 

We don’t have strict requirements for formal education or years of experience in a specific career, but needless to say, we’re looking for someone with proven success who is ready for the next stepping stone of their career. To that end, these bullet points should seem comfortable:

  • 2+ years of experience in a client-facing role at an ad network, advertising agency or media publication. It is important to have a general understanding of how publishers make money on the web today
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • A strong ability to perform independently while working in a team environment
  • Ability to get things done as a “self-starter,” i.e., without micromanagement
  • A strong knowledge of the online advertising industry
  • Detail oriented and extremely organized with strong time management
  • A proactive problem solver, quick learner and strategic thinker
  • Ability to analyze and interpret data, and draw strategic recommendations from analysis
  • Proficiency in Google Analytics, optimization and ESP software, Excel, Keynote and Trello  
  • Comfortable with the idea of working remotely
  • Articulate, charismatic, and all of the associated personality traits of a likeable human being.

Additional information:

  • Must be eligible to work as a full time employee in the United States
  • Medical/Dental/Vision insurance plans available
  • A few additional perks

Apply: To apply, please send over a resume/CSV and answer the following questions in the space provided:Who are you?Why do you want to work for BSA?Showcase your ability to manage projects across multiple functionsProvide an example of a time you took initiative to solve a problem

Are you passionate about podcasting and the art of interviewing subject-matter experts on-air?  Our Podcast Producer role could be for you.

As a Podcast Producer at Audience Ops, you’ll be the on-air host and producer for several of our clients’ podcasts.  All will be audio podcasts, some will also be video (posted to YouTube).  You should be comfortable on-air in both formats.
This is an ongoing role, with steady, weekly work for a growing number of podcasts.  You’ll be joining our awesome remote content team.
Here’s why our writers love being part of the Audience Ops team:

  • Steady, longterm, reliable freelance retainer.
  • You get to brainstorm and research your own topics for podcast episodes.
  • Our editors and other teammates are here to support you.
  • Work from anywhere (as long as you have a quiet, reliable work environment for recording)
  • The best team Slack chat on the Internet

As a Podcast Producer, you will be responsible for:
  • Planning and preparing episode topics and interview questions.
  • Communicating with clients and our team over calls, emails, and Slack.
  • Coordinating scheduling and production of episodes.
  • Hosting and recording the episodes with a co-host or guest.
  • Writing brief show notes for each episodes.

(We’ll have someone else take care of audio editing, uploading, and setup, but experience with these is a plus!).

Most episodes will be interview-based where you will interview a subject-matter expert.
All podcasts will be business focused, in a variety of niches.  You should be comfortable with diving into topics and subject matter that may be unfamiliar to you, but you can do light research to confidently host an on-air interview with a subject-matter expert.  By the way, in your application, please tell us the name of your favorite podcast!
If you have any experience with these areas, it’s a plus:
  • Startups
  • Tech / software products
  • Online marketing
  • Web design & development
  • Software development
  • WordPress
  • Business team collaboration
  • Enterpreneurship

You must own your own proper equipment / recording environment:
  • Decent microphone
  • Web cam for videos
  • Computer with stable Internet connection
  • Clean and distraction-free space to record on-air episodes.

You must be based in the United States and available during weekday business hours.
Is this you?  Apply using the link provided.

Apply for this position

Apply here: https://audienceops.com/jobs/podcast-producer/?src=weworkremotely

Sales Executive at Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org

Dubai, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Sales, Education
Compensation
$33K–$100K
No Equity

Job Description

Are you amazing at sales and looking for a new opportunity with big incentives? Are you result oriented?

We are looking to hire a passionate sales executive with experience in either educational or technology sales.

You will be building relationships with key partners and selling an educational software solution that is growing globally and helping thousands of students have access to education on a daily basis.

We are looking for someone with an eye for sales, passion for education/tech and an international approach.

We are a growing dynamic and international team looking for the right people to make things happen. Do you have what it takes?

Functional Role:

- Sell educational products to schools, governments, institutes and HR departments.

- Implement marketing and promotion strategy to the identified key operators to promote Teach Me Now as a software-as-a-service solution to further advance the teaching and learning process of schools, institutions and governments;

- Continuously improve marketing and and sales strategies;

- Coordinate with set up of new customers;

Required Skills / Experience:

- You must be fluent in English

- Background in education and technology sales

- Result driven and a proven track record of targets

- Full of initiative

- Knowledge and experience of sales and marketing strategy

- Strategic Thinking and planning skills

- Presentation Skills/ Good at Public Speaking

- Communication & Relationship Management

Apply with your cv and cover letter to hr@teachmenow.com today.

items.title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer at WebRTC.ventures
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Database Administrator
Industry: Computer Software, Web Design, Web Development
Company size: 51-200 people

Job description

The Report Developer is primarily responsible for building reports and other Visualization products (subscriptions, views on reports, etc.) and administering user accounts for Visualization products. The Report Developer may also be responsible for making bug fixes on Visualization products and interacting with customers on report design and report validation. With training, the Report Developer will graduate to creating and/or modifying domains, topics, database queries or other means of extracting data from the analytics warehouse.

Your experience should show some or all of these:

  • One to two years experience with at least one Reporting/Analytics commercial product
  • Exploration of data through ad hoc reporting
  • Deep SQL skills querying a relational database
  • Working knowledge of data warehousing concepts
  • Exacting standards and attention to detail
  • Efficiency and a desire to execute time-saving strategies
  • Analytical disposition that often leads to new or greater insight 

It’s great if your experience also demonstrates:

  • Experience with Jaspersoft to build ad hocs, reports, and dashboards
  • Experience with ETL tools
  • Educational background in statistics
  • Agility in a Linux environment
  • Work in an AWS environment
  • Familiarity with the commercial trucking industry

Education:

4 year degree or equivalent experience

About WebRTC.ventures

AgilityFeat was founded in 2010 by Arin Sime. Arin lives in Virginia, and travels around the companies American training methodologies agile and Scrum and Kanban.

In 2011, Arin was associated with David Alfaro of Costa Rica to begin providing development services software nearshore to customers AgilityFeat in the USA. David is a leading IT experience in Costa Rica, and well known in Costa Rica as one of the first to bring Agile to America Central.

David and Arin ensure that AgilityFeat always strives to deliver high quality services and high efficiency for our customers.

But our team full command so that really makes us special. Read our Commando's Creed to know the values that have made us successful http://www.agilityfeat.com/creed

Benefits

100% Remote - Work From Home
Paid Company Outings
Flexible Work Hours
Passionate People
Cutting Edge Technologies
Ideal Environment for Creative Minds

items.title: Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
The Role

You're a hunter at heart but can bring the balance of empathy to our customers as we solve a very important problem. Make no mistake you are responsible for new business and converting leads.

The primary objective of an Account Executive will be to deliver the SafetyCulture value proposition, demonstrate solutions to their pain points, and follow up with them to solve their issues.

As part of our Manchester team you'll be the first point of contact for high potential customers in the UK and Europe, working with them to ensure they have the best possible introduction for their implementation of iAuditor throughout their organisation.

Are you game?

The Soul

You give a sh#t. You live and breathe customer solutions and you never (ever) give up until the problem is solved. You are a product advocate who is passionate about putting safety and quality in the hands of every worker.

You’re not a passenger! You want to change the world. We are aiming for 1 million workers improving safety and quality by 2020.

You’re driven to achieve, and than better those achievements again and again.

The Responsibilities

- Hunting for and connecting with high potential leads, finding your way to the right decision maker and assisting the customer through a potential trial
- Leads you’ll work may be already using the SafetyCulture solution to a small degree or might come through our marketing function - whether conferences, webinars, partnerships team or online enquiries
- Outstanding verbal and written communication skills and experience in a sales positions within the SaaS and B2B software space
- Proven work ethic, a commitment to personal development and an attitude of self-motivation.
- Deliver/present the SafetyCulture value proposition both online and in person
- Work with Sales Leadership and other critical company resources to meet or exceed company revenue goal
- Form strong links and collaborate with all teams across SafetyCulture
- Formal training and/or applied experience in sales methodologies such as Sandler, Command of the Message, Miller Heiman, or SPIN Selling

Why SafetyCulture

- We’re operating at a scale few other companies are, and you’ll be doing challenging work that impacts millions every day and helps to move the world forward.
- We have money in the bank and plentiful investors knocking on our doors
- We have HUGE ambitions. We aren’t scared to aim for tens of millions of users by 2025
- We operate within a largely untapped market with endless possibilities and we are a part of a new, exciting wave of SaaS companies that focus on frontline workers
- We know a thing or two about making our employees happy, and we go the extra mile connecting our people to our mission. The experience trips are an example of how we're pushing the boundaries of company culture and employee engagement

Location:

There is always something to explore in Manchester! Between the booming restaurant scene, interesting museums and galleries, and theatre and arts, Manchester is thriving. Not to mention, they can pour a good pint. Our office is located in the heart of the Northern Quarter, in an awesome warehouse space, surrounded by tech and creative businesses, and just a 5 minute walk from Piccadilly Station.

items.content:
*About Geoblink*
Geoblink was founded in March 2015 with the goal of revolutionising the world of Location Intelligence and the way businesses think about, and act upon location intelligence data. We’ve already made some huge waves in the industry, raised more than 6M Euros in investment from top venture capital firms so far and been named by Bloomberg as ‘one of the 50 most promising startups of the world’

Everyone at Geoblink is passionate about what they do, whether it be increasing businesses ROI or building complex data systems. People join Geoblink not just for the flexible work schedule, unlimited vacations, and unlimited tea/coffee/beers/cokes but because we offer everyone the opportunity to have real impact in the business and collaborate with some off the best minds in the industry (think McKinsey, MIT, CERN or EA Games). If you’re looking to get your foot in the door at a fast growing tech start-up and work your way up the career ladder then we have the perfect positions for you!

*Who we’re looking to recruit*
We are looking for a highly energetic Sales Development Representative to be the liaison between our Marketing and Sales teams in the UK, Spanish or French market depending on your language skills, although the job is based in Madrid. You will be responsible for proactively seeking out and building new business opportunities in the market in order to boost sales and contribute to our long-term business growth. Don’t have any previous sales experience? No problem! What is important for us is that you are smart, empathetic that can easily build rapport with clients. Here is a list of some other things that we think would make someone good at the job:
* Goal driven and confident
* Strong communicator (both written and verbal)
* Fluent in either English, Spanish or French
* Tenacious and good with objection handling and problem solving
* Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls) is a bonus

*What you will be doing*
* Contacting potential clients through cold calls and emails to create business opportunities in the market
* Seeking out new leads to introduce Geoblink solution
* Identify potential clients’ business needs in order to communicate this to the Account Executives
* Build trusting and long lasting customer relationships from the start in order to contribute to the country team’s growth goals

*Perks of the job*
* Unlimited holidays, flexible work schedule or ability to work from home
* Unlimited coffee, tea, coke to keep you going
* Chillout space with ping-pong, table football, etc
* Attractive compensation package
* Lots of space for you to work in peace so you can produce your best work
* Opportunity to collaborate with some of the best people in the industry
* Great career progression
* Quarterly off sites to awesome destinations, language tan

items.title: Enterprise Account Executive (French speaking)
items.content:
InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate  every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 3.5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.

Are you an experienced sales leader with a passion for design? Can you comfortably convey your enthusiasm, energy and good sense of humor over the phone? Are you well-connected to peers in leadership roles within design, product marketing, UX or user research? Do you possess a special skill for juggling responsibilities while wearing multiple hats?

We're looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to capitalize on our growing global footprint, and own our European presence as we rapidly expand our Enterprise sales efforts in EMEA.

*Requirements*:

*5 years or more of inside sales experience in a B2B SaaS vertical
*Consistent track record of exceeding quota
*Referenceable executive-level customers at Fortune 2000 companies, major digital agencies and prominent tech firms
*Action-oriented and results driven, with a willingness to learn and adapt
*Fluent French speaker

*Responsibilities*

*Manage full sales cycle in a consultative manner, from initial qualification through product demo through follow up calls to closing
*You will enjoy being a visible presence for InVision in EMEA by being an active participant at industry conferences and networking events, engaged in client and prospective client on-sites and with the overall design community
*In addition to handling incoming leads, you will develop new business opportunities through your own efforts
*Drive strategic direction of InVision sales and customer success presence in EMEA
*Manage against company revenue targets
*Potential to build broader team to support EMEA growth
